_comment: EXAMPLE ONLY - Partial reference for Manitoba to illustrate structure

global_rules.rule_text: A Continuing Patient Relationship is defined as an ongoing clinical relationship between a physician and a patient where the physician has accepted responsibility for the patient's care...[truncated for example]
A consultation is a service rendered by a specialist physician at the request of a referring physician...[truncated for example]

sections.section_preamble: These benefits cannot be correctly interpreted without reference to the Rules of Application.
These benefits cannot be correctly interpreted without reference to the Rules of Application.

codes.description: Virtual visit by telephone or video
codes.description_full: Virtual visit by telephone or video

codes.description: Virtual consultation by telephone or video
codes.description_full: Virtual consultation by telephone or video

codes.description: Comprehensive Virtual Assessment by telephone or video
codes.description_full: Comprehensive Virtual Assessment by telephone or video
codes.notes_verbatim: Note: 8447 may only be provided as part of a Continuing Patient Relationship as described in Rule of Application 62.

codes.description: Basic virtual visit by telephone or video
codes.description_full: Basic virtual visit by telephone or video. Generally less than ten (10) minutes of physician time.
codes.notes_verbatim: Generally less than ten (10) minutes of physician time.

codes.description_full: Extended clinic hours 0600 to 0800 (6:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.) on Monday – Friday or 1700 to 2359 hours (5:00 p.m. to 11:59 p.m.) on Monday – Thursday excluding designated holidays, or 0700 to 1659 hours (7:00 a.m. to 4:59 p.m.) on Saturday, Sunday and designated Holidays (see note 5 below) add.
codes.notes_verbatim: Adds 20% to the payable fee for eligible services (including virtual visits) that commence during the specified extended clinic hours, provided the clinic meets the regular-hours and advertising requirements and offers an in-person option. Not payable with certain specified tariffs (5555, 5553, 5550, 5556, 5557, 5558) or for services starting before the extended-hours period. Time of service must be entered on the claim.

codes.description_full: Extended clinic hours 1700 to 2359 (5:00 p.m. to 11:59 p.m) on Friday, Saturday, Sunday and designated Holidays (see note 5 below) add
codes.notes_verbatim: Adds 30% to the payable fee for eligible services (including virtual visits) that commence during the specified extended clinic hours on Friday, Saturday, Sunday and designated holidays, subject to the same clinic eligibility and exclusions as 5530. Time of service must be entered on the claim.

code_attributes.extraction_notes: Note states 'generally less than ten (10) minutes'

code_attributes.attribute_value: Continuing Patient Relationship required per Rule 62

modifiers.conditions_verbatim: Services commencing 0600-0800 Mon-Fri or 1700-2359 Mon-Thu excluding holidays, or 0700-1659 Sat/Sun/Holidays. Clinic must offer in-person option.
Services commencing 1700-2359 on Fri/Sat/Sun/Holidays. Same clinic eligibility as 5530.

exclusions.conditions: Same patient, same day - only one virtual visit type may be billed
After-hours premium codes are mutually exclusive

relationships.conditions: When 8321 rendered during extended clinic hours
When 8321 rendered during weekend/holiday evening hours
8340 is lower-value episodic variant of 8321 for telephone-only
